title: Warren Buffett gave airlines another go. Coronavirus was a problem he couldn't stomach
description: Warren Buffett has again ditched the airline sector as coronavirus threatens to be a challenge too big for him to stomach.

title: Trump says he believes there will be a coronavirus vaccine 'by the end of the year'
description: President Donald Trump said on Sunday that he was confident that there will be a coronavirus vaccine by the end of the year.

title: Electric cars take the spotlight in China's post-coronavirus stimulus plans
description: Jing Yang, director of corporate research at Fitch Ratings, expects electric vehicles to outperform an overall slump in China's car sales this year given strong policy support.

title: Coronavirus live updates: Global cases top 3.5 million, Trump predicts a vaccine by end of 2020
description: Public health officials have said a coronavirus vaccine could take a year to 18 months.

title: Dow futures fall nearly 300 points amid concerns over reopening the economy
description: Stock futures fell on Sunday night as traders weighed the reopening of the economy along with brewing tensions between China and the U.S.

title: Stocks are in little danger of retesting the March low, top strategist Art Hogan says
description: National Securities' Art Hogan believes the consensus view that markets will stage another sharp pullback is wrong.

title: Trump says China made a 'mistake' and tried to cover up coronavirus outbreak
description: President Donald Trump said Sunday that he believed that a "mistake" in China was the cause of the spreading coronavirus pandemic, though he did not present any evidence for the claim.

title: UK's Boris Johnson says doctors prepared to announce his death as he fought COVID-19
description: "The doctors had all sorts of arrangements for what to do if things went badly wrong," Johnson said, NBC News reports.

title: US intelligence documents accuse China of covering up coronavirus outbreak severity to hoard supplies
description: The report also says China held off informing the World Health Organization that the coronavirus "was a contagion" for much of January so it could order medical supplies from abroad.

title: Cuomo calls PPE shortages a national security issue: 'You can't be dependent on China'
description: New York will require all hospitals to build a 90-day supply of personal protective equipment in the face of another outbreak after states dealt with widespread equipment shortages battling the coronavirus, New York Governor Andrew Cuomo announced on Sunday.

title: Buffett on coronavirus, airlines and more: Watch the 5 best moments from the Berkshire meeting
description: Berkshire Hathaway's 2020 annual shareholder meeting, the "Woodstock for Capitalists," was hosted virtually for the first time ever.

title: Coronavirus live updates: Roche to invest in German testing site, CEO says recovered patients 'very likely' immune
description: Covid-19 has infected more than 3.5 million people around the world as of Monday, killing at least 247,752 people.

title: Goldman Sachs outlines 'useful lessons' from China's reopening following the coronavirus outbreak
description: China was the first country to be affected by the coronavirus disease â€” and it appeared to be among the first to contain the outbreak, as far as official data showed.

title: Dow futures fall more than 200 points to start the week, airline stocks drop on Buffett sale
description: Stock futures fell in premarket trading Monday as traders weighed the reopening of the economy along with brewing tensions between China and the U.S.

title: US airline stocks tumble after Buffett sells whole stakes
description: Airline shares were headed for another day of sharp declines, this time after Warren Buffett said Berkshire Hathaway's cashed out of its stakes in the four largest carriers.

title: Tyson Foods shares fall 7% as production disruptions take a toll on profits, company secures $1.5 billion loan facility
description: Tyson Foods on Monday reported that its fiscal second-quarter net income fell 15% from a year earlier, as production disruptions weighed on its results.

title: Apple announces new 13-inch MacBook Pro that fixes its keyboard problems
description: It's Apple's latest hardware announcement, following several that were made in the previous weeks. In March, Apple launched its new MacBook Air laptop and two iPad Pros. Then, in April, it released its new $399 iPhone SE.

title: Preppy retailer J.Crew files for bankruptcy
description: The New York-based retailer said it has secured $400 million in financing from existing lenders to finance operations through bankruptcy.

title: Stock market live updates: Futures lower, Buffett dumps airlines, states reopen
description: Stock futures pointed to losses at the open on Monday, extending Friday's sharp decline.

title: Here's how to listen as the Supreme Court broadcasts oral arguments for first time ever
description: The Supreme Court case is a fight over whether Booking.com can trademark its name. The format of the arguments, which will be conducted over the phone, has proven even more controversial.

title: Stocks making the biggest moves in the premarket: Berkshire Hathaway, Gilead, Disney, Intel & more
description: The stocks making the biggest moves in premarket trading include Berkshire Hathaway, Gilead, Disney, Intel, and more.

title: Small business confidence crashes, revealing more Main Street carnage may lie ahead
description: Main Street confidence hit a record low in the Q2 2020 CNBC Small Business Survey, with the coronavirus causing a majority of entrepreneurs to fear permanent changes, including bankruptcy.

title: Clock ticking for small businesses squeezed out of government loans, now have a few months or less to survive, survey reveals
description: Only 13% of small businesses that applied for relief through the Paycheck Protection Program have received funding, according to the CNBC/SurveyMonkey Small Business Survey released Monday.

title: Gambling stocks: These two may have hit bottom, traders say
description: With gambling stocks hit hard by coronavirus closures, the worst may have passed for these two casinos, strategists said.

title: Pharma giants granted coronavirus approvals but doubts remain on manufacturing a global vaccine
description: Experts warn that vaccine timelines look ambitious and argue more thought is needed on manufacturing.

title: China has questions to answer over the coronavirus outbreak, UK minister says
description: The U.K. has added to international pressure on China to answer questions over information it gave the world about the coronavirus outbreak.

title: A coronavirus vaccine cannot be reasonably expected until the end of 2021, professor says
description: That timeline would be a "very reasonable" expectation because of the necessary Phase 2 and 3 trials of any vaccine to guarantee both safety and efficacy, according to Dale Fisher, chair of the World Health Organization (WHO) Global Outbreak Alert and Response Network.

title: Gold has 'growing potential' to break $1,800 an ounce, says UBS
description: Gold prices could "break the highs" seen earlier this year, after declining in March along with assets across the board, according to UBS Investment Bank's Joni Teves.

title: Gilead CEO says remdesivir will be available to patients this week: 'We've donated the entire supply'
description: Gilead Sciences coronavirus fighting drug will be in the hands of patients as early as this week, the biotechnology company's CEO said Sunday.

title: UK coronavirus death toll set to overtake Italy's with exit strategy still unknown
description: As of Sunday, the U.K. has seen 28,446 deaths as a result of Covid-19, closely behind Italy's 28,884 deaths, according to data from JHU.

title: China hid severity of the virus so it could hoard supplies, intelligence documents show
description: China held off informing the World Health Organization that the coronavirus "was a contagion" for much of January so it could order medical supplies from abroad.
